44017014	Right away the believers sent Paul to the coast . But Silas and Timothy stayed in Berea .
44017015	The men who went with Paul took him to Athens . Then they returned with orders that Silas and Timothy were supposed to join him as soon as they could .
44017016	Paul was waiting for Silas and Timothy in Athens . He was very upset to see that the city was full of statues of gods .
44017017	So he went to the synagogue . There he talked with Jews and with Greeks who worshiped God . Each day he spoke with anyone who happened to be in the market place .
44017018	A group of Epicurean and Stoic thinkers began to argue with him . Some of them asked , " What is this fellow chattering about ? " Others said , " He seems to be telling us about gods we've never heard of . " They said this because Paul was preaching the good news about Jesus . He was telling them that Jesus had risen from the dead .
44017019	They took him to a meeting of the Areopagus . There they said to him , " What is this new teaching you're giving us ?
44017020	You have some strange ideas . We've never heard them before . We want to know what they mean . "
44017021	All the people of Athens spent their time talking about and listening to the latest ideas . People from other lands who lived there did the same .
44017022	Then Paul stood up in the meeting of the Areopagus . He said , " Men of Athens ! I see that you are very religious in every way .
44017023	As I walked around , I looked carefully at the things you worship . I even found an altar with to an unknown god written on it . Now I am going to tell you about this ' unknown god ' that you worship .
44017024	" He is the God who made the world . He also made everything in it . He is the Lord of heaven and earth . He doesn't live in temples built by hands .
44017025	He is not served by human hands . He doesn't need anything . He himself gives life and breath to all people . He also gives them everything else they have .
44017026	From one man he made all the people of the world . Now they live all over the earth . He decided exactly when they should live . And he decided exactly where they should live .
44017027	God did this so that people would seek him . Then perhaps they would reach out for him and find him . They would find him even though he is not far from any of us .
44017028	' In him we live and move and exist . ' As some of your own poets have also said , ' We are his children . '
44017029	" Yes , we are God's children . So we shouldn't think that God is made out of gold or silver or stone . He isn't a statue planned and made by clever people .
44017030	In the past , God didn't judge people for what they didn't know . But now he commands all people everywhere to turn away from their sins .
44017031	He has set a day when he will judge the world fairly . He has appointed a man to be its judge . God has proved this to all people by raising that man from the dead . "
44017032	When they heard Paul talk about the dead rising , some of them made fun of it . But others said , " We want to hear you speak about this again . "
44017033	So Paul left the meeting of the Areopagus .
44017034	A few men became followers of Paul and believed in Jesus . Dionysius was one of them . He was a member of the Areopagus . A woman named Damaris also became a believer . And so did some others .
44018001	After this , Paul left Athens and went to Corinth .
44018002	There he met a Jew named Aquila , who was a native of Pontus . Aquila had recently come from Italy with his wife Priscilla . The emperor Claudius had ordered all the Jews to leave Rome . Paul went to see Aquila and Priscilla .
44018003	They were tentmakers , just as he was . So he stayed and worked with them .
44018004	Every Sabbath day he went to the synagogue . He was trying to get both Jews and Greeks to believe in the Lord .
44018005	Silas and Timothy came from Macedonia . Then Paul spent all his time preaching . He gave witness to the Jews that Jesus was the Christ .
44018006	But the Jews opposed Paul . They treated him badly . He didn't like this . So he shook out his clothes . Then he said to them , " Anything that happens to you will be your own fault ! Don't blame me for it ! From now on I will go to people who are not Jews . "
44018007	Then Paul left the synagogue . He went next door to the house of Titius Justus , a man who worshiped God .
44018008	Crispus was the synagogue ruler . He and his whole family came to believe in the Lord . Many others who lived in Corinth heard Paul . They too believed and were baptized .
44018009	One night the Lord spoke to Paul in a vision . " Don't be afraid , " he said . " Keep on speaking . Don't be silent .
44018010	I am with you . No one will attack you and harm you . I have many people in this city . "
44018011	So Paul stayed there for a year and a half . He taught them God's word .
44018012	At that time Gallio was governor of Achaia . The Jews got together and attacked Paul . They brought him into court .
44018013	" This man , " they charged , " is trying to talk people into worshiping God in ways that are against the law . "
44018014	Paul was about to speak up for himself . But just then Gallio spoke to the Jews . " You Jews are not claiming that Paul has committed a crime , whether large or small , " he said . " If you were , it would make sense for me to listen to you .
44018015	But this is about your own law . It is a question of words and names . Settle the matter yourselves . I will not be a judge of such things . "
44018016	So he had them thrown out of the court .
44018017	Then all the Jews turned against Sosthenes . He was the synagogue ruler . They beat him up in front of the court . But Gallio didn't care at all .
44018018	Paul stayed in Corinth for some time . Then he left the believers and sailed for Syria . Priscilla and Aquila went with him . Before he sailed , he had his hair cut off at Cenchrea . He did this because he had made a promise to God .
44018019	They arrived at Ephesus . There Paul said good-by to Priscilla and Aquila . He himself went into the synagogue and talked with the Jews .
44018020	The Jews asked him to spend more time with them . But he said no .
44018021	As he left , he made them a promise . " If God wants me to , " he said , " I will come back . " Then he sailed from Ephesus .
44018022	When he landed at Caesarea , he went up to Jerusalem . There he greeted the church . He then went down to Antioch .
44018023	Paul spent some time in Antioch . Then he left and traveled all over Galatia and Phrygia . He gave strength to all the believers there .
44018024	At that time a Jew named Apollos came to Ephesus . He was an educated man from Alexandria . He knew the Scriptures very well .
44018025	Apollos had been taught the way of the Lord . He spoke with great power . He taught the truth about Jesus . But he only knew about John's baptism .
44018026	He began to speak boldly in the synagogue . Priscilla and Aquila heard him . So they invited him to their home . There they gave him a better understanding of the way of God .
44018027	Apollos wanted to go to Achaia . The brothers agreed with him . They wrote to the believers there . They asked them to welcome him . When he arrived , he was a great help to those who had become believers by God's grace .
44018028	He argued strongly against the Jews in public meetings . He proved from the Scriptures that Jesus was the Christ .
44019001	While Apollos was at Corinth , Paul took the road to Ephesus . When he arrived , he found some believers there .
44019002	He asked them , " Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you became believers ? " " No , " they answered . " We haven't even heard that there is a Holy Spirit . "
44019003	So Paul asked , " Then what baptism did you receive ? " " John's baptism , " they replied .
44019004	Paul said , " John baptized people , calling them to turn away from their sins . He told them to believe in the one who was coming after him . Jesus is that one . "
44019005	After hearing this , they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus .
44019006	Paul placed his hands on them . Then the Holy Spirit came on them . They spoke in languages they had not known before . They also prophesied .
44019007	There were about 12 of them in all .
44019008	Paul entered the synagogue . There he spoke boldly for three months . He tried to talk the people into accepting his teaching about God's kingdom .
44019009	But some of them wouldn't listen . They refused to believe . In public they said evil things about the Way of Jesus . So Paul left them . He took the believers with him . Each day he talked with people in the lecture hall of Tyrannus .
44019010	This went on for two years . So all the Jews and Greeks who lived in Asia Minor heard the word of the Lord .
44019011	God did amazing miracles through Paul .
44019012	Even handkerchiefs and aprons that had touched him were taken to those who were sick . When this happened , their sicknesses were healed and evil spirits left them .
44019013	Some Jews went around driving out evil spirits . They tried to use the name of the Lord Jesus to set free those who were controlled by demons . They said , " In Jesus' name I command you to come out . He is the Jesus that Paul is preaching about . "
44019014	Seven sons of Sceva were doing this . Sceva was a Jewish chief priest .
44019015	One day the evil spirit answered them , " I know Jesus . And I know about Paul . But who are you ? "
44019016	Then the man who had the evil spirit jumped on Sceva's sons . He overpowered them all . He gave them a terrible beating . They ran out of the house naked and bleeding .
44019017	The Jews and Greeks living in Ephesus heard about this . They were all overcome with fear . They held the name of the Lord Jesus in high honor .
44019018	Many who believed now came and openly admitted the evil they had done .
44019019	A number of those who had practiced evil magic brought their scrolls together . They set them on fire out in the open . They added up the value of the scrolls . They found that it would take more than two lifetimes to earn what the scrolls were worth .
44019020	The word of the Lord spread everywhere . It became more and more powerful .
44019021	After all this had happened , Paul decided to go to Jerusalem . He went through Macedonia and Achaia . " After I have been to Jerusalem , " he said , " I must visit Rome also . "
44019022	He sent Timothy and Erastus , two of his helpers , to Macedonia . But he stayed a little longer in Asia Minor .
44019023	At that time many people became very upset about the Way of Jesus .
44019024	There was a man named Demetrius who made things out of silver . He made silver models of the temple of the goddess Artemis . He brought in a lot of business for the other skilled workers .
44019025	One day he called them together . He also called others who were in the same kind of business . " Men , " he said , " you know that we make good money from our work .
44019026	You have seen and heard what this fellow Paul is doing . He has talked to large numbers of people here in Ephesus . Almost everywhere in Asia Minor he has led people away from our gods . He says that the gods we make are not gods at all .
44019027	Our work is in danger of losing its good name . People's faith in the temple of the great goddess Artemis will be weakened . Now she is worshiped through all of Asia Minor and the whole world . But soon she will be robbed of her greatness . "
44019028	When they heard this , they became very angry . They began shouting , " Great is Artemis of the Ephesians ! "
44019029	Soon people were making trouble in the whole city . They all rushed into the theater . They dragged Gaius and Aristarchus along with them . These two men had come with Paul from Macedonia .
44019030	Paul wanted to appear in front of the crowd . But the believers wouldn't let him .
44019031	Some of the officials in Asia Minor were friends of Paul . They sent him a message , begging him not to go into the theater .
44019032	The crowd didn't know what was going on . Some were shouting one thing and some another . Most of the people didn't even know why they were there .
44019033	The Jews pushed Alexander to the front . Some of the crowd tried to tell him what to say . But he motioned for them to be quiet . He wanted to speak up for himself in front of the people .
44019034	But then they realized that he was a Jew . So they all shouted the same thing for about two hours . " Great is Artemis of the Ephesians ! " they yelled .
44019035	The city clerk quieted the crowd down . " Men of Ephesus ! " he said . " The whole world knows that the city of Ephesus guards the temple of the great Artemis . They know that Ephesus guards her statue , which fell from heaven .
44019036	These facts can't be questioned . So calm down . Don't do anything foolish .
44019037	" These men haven't robbed any temples . They haven't said evil things against our goddess . But you have brought them here anyhow .
44019038	Demetrius and the other skilled workers may feel they have been wronged by someone . Let them bring charges . The courts are open . We have our governors .
44019039	Is there anything else you want to bring up ? Settle it in a court of law .
44019040	As it is , today we are in danger of being charged with causing all this trouble . But there is no reason for it . We wouldn't be able to explain what has happened . "
44019041	After he said this , he sent the people away .
44020001	All the trouble came to an end . Then Paul sent for the believers . After cheering them up , he said good-by . He then left for Macedonia .
44020002	He traveled through that area , speaking many words of hope to the people . Finally he arrived in Greece .
44020003	There he stayed for three months . He was just about to sail for Syria . But the Jews were making plans against him . So he decided to go back through Macedonia .
44020004	Sopater , son of Pyrrhus , from Berea went with him . Aristarchus and Secundus from Thessalonica , Gaius from Derbe , and Timothy went too . Tychicus and Trophimus from Asia Minor also went with him .
44020005	These men went on ahead . They waited for us at Troas .
44020006	But we sailed from Philippi after the Feast of Unleavened Bread . Five days later we joined the others at Troas . We stayed there for seven days .
44020007	On the first day of the week we met to break bread and eat together . Paul spoke to the people . He kept on talking until midnight because he planned to leave the next day .
44020008	There were many lamps in the room upstairs where we were meeting .
44020009	A young man named Eutychus was sitting in a window . He sank into a deep sleep as Paul talked on and on . Sound asleep , Eutychus fell from the third floor . When they picked him up from the ground , he was dead .
44020010	Paul went down and threw himself on the young man . He put his arms around him . " Don't be alarmed , " he told them . " He's alive ! "
44020011	Then Paul went upstairs again . He broke bread and ate with them . He kept on talking until daylight . Then he left .
44020012	The people took the young man home . They were greatly comforted because he was alive .
44020013	We went on ahead to the ship . We sailed for Assos . There we were going to take Paul on board . He had planned it this way because he wanted to go there by land .
44020014	So he met us at Assos . We took him on board and went on to Mitylene .
44020015	The next day we sailed from there . We arrived near Kios . The day after that we crossed over to Samos . We arrived at Miletus the next day .
44020016	Paul had decided to sail past Ephesus . He didn't want to spend time in Asia Minor . He was in a hurry to get to Jerusalem . If he could , he wanted to be there by the day of Pentecost .
44020017	From Miletus , Paul sent for the elders of the church at Ephesus .
44020018	When they arrived , he spoke to them . " You know how I lived the whole time I was with you , " he said . " From the first day I came into Asia Minor ,
44020019	I was free of pride . I served the Lord with tears . I served him even though I was greatly tested by the evil plans of the Jews .
44020020	You know I haven't let anyone keep me from preaching anything that would be helpful to you . I have taught you in public and from house to house .
44020021	I have told both Jews and Greeks that they must turn away from their sins to God . They must have faith in our Lord Jesus .
44020022	" Now I am going to Jerusalem . The Holy Spirit compels me . I don't know what will happen to me there .
44020023	I only know that in every city the Spirit warns me . He tells me that I will face prison and suffering .
44020024	But my life means nothing to me . I only want to finish the race . I want to complete the work the Lord Jesus has given me . He wants me to give witness to others about the good news of God's grace .
44020025	" I have spent time with you preaching about the kingdom . I know that none of you will ever see me again .
44020026	So I tell you today that I am not guilty if anyone has not believed .
44020027	I haven't let anyone keep me from telling you everything God wants you to do .
44020028	" Keep watch over yourselves . Keep watch over all the believers . The Holy Spirit has made you leaders over them . Be shepherds of God's church . He bought it with his own blood .
44020029	" I know that after I leave , wild wolves will come in among you . They won't spare any of the sheep .
44020030	Even men from your own people will rise up and twist the truth . They want to get the believers to follow them .
44020031	So be on your guard ! Remember that for three years I never stopped warning you . Night and day I warned each of you with tears .
44020032	" Now I commit you to God's care . I commit you to the word of his grace . It can build you up . Then you will share in what God plans to give all his people .
44020033	I haven't longed for anyone's silver or gold or clothing .
44020034	You yourselves know that I have used my own hands to meet my needs . I have also met the needs of my companions .
44020035	In everything I did , I showed you that we must work hard and help the weak . We must remember the words of the Lord Jesus . He said , ' It is more blessed to give than to receive . ' "
44020036	When Paul had said this , he got down on his knees with all of them and prayed .
44020037	They all cried as they hugged and kissed him .
44020038	What hurt them the most was that he had said they would never see his face again . Then they went with him to the ship .
44021001	After we had torn ourselves away from the Ephesian elders , we headed out to sea . We sailed straight to Cos . The next day we went to Rhodes . From there we continued on to Patara .
44021002	We found a ship crossing over to Phoenicia . So we went on board and headed out to sea .
44021003	We came near Cyprus and passed to the south of it . Then we sailed on to Syria . We landed at Tyre . There our ship was supposed to unload .
44021004	We found the believers there and stayed with them for seven days . Led by the Holy Spirit , they tried to get Paul not to go on to Jerusalem .
44021005	But when it was time to leave , we continued on our way . All the believers and their families went with us out of the city . There on the beach we got down on our knees to pray .
44021006	We said good-by to each other . Then we went on board the ship . And they returned home .
44021007	Continuing on from Tyre , we landed at Ptolemais . There we greeted the brothers and sisters . We stayed with them for a day .
44021008	The next day we left and arrived at Caesarea . We stayed at the house of Philip the evangelist . He was one of the seven deacons .
44021009	He had four unmarried daughters who prophesied .
44021010	We stayed there several days . Then a prophet named Agabus came down from Judea .
44021011	He came over to us . Then he took Paul's belt and tied his own hands and feet with it . He said , " The Holy Spirit says , ' This is how the Jews of Jerusalem will tie up the owner of this belt . They will hand him over to people who are not Jews . ' "
44021012	When we heard this , we all begged Paul not to go up to Jerusalem .
44021013	He asked , " Why are you crying ? Why are you breaking my heart ? I'm ready to be put in prison . In fact , I'm ready to die in Jerusalem for the Lord Jesus . "
44021014	We couldn't change his mind . So we gave up . We said , " May what the Lord wants to happen be done . "
44021015	After this , we got ready and went up to Jerusalem .
44021016	Some of the believers from Caesarea went with us . They brought us to Mnason's home . We were supposed to stay there . Mnason was from Cyprus . He was one of the first believers .
44021017	When we arrived in Jerusalem , the brothers and sisters gave us a warm welcome .
44021018	The next day Paul and the rest of us went to see James . All the elders were there .
44021019	Paul greeted them . Then he reported everything God had done among the non-Jews through his work .
44021020	When they heard this , they praised God . Then they spoke to Paul . " Brother , " they said , " you see that thousands of Jews have become believers . All of them try very hard to obey the law .
44021021	They have been told that you teach all the Jews who live among the non-Jews to turn away from Moses . They think that you teach them not to circumcise their children . They think that you teach them to give up our Jewish ways .
44021022	" What should we do ? They will certainly hear that you have come .
44021023	So do what we tell you . There are four men with us who have made a promise to God .
44021024	Take them with you . Join them in the Jewish practice that makes people pure and clean . Pay their expenses so they can have their heads shaved . Then everybody will know that these reports about you are not true in any way . They will know that you yourself obey the law .
44021025	" We have already given written directions to the believers who are not Jews . They must not eat food that has been offered to statues of gods . They must not drink blood . They must not eat the meat of animals that have been choked to death . And they must not commit sexual sins . "
44021026	The next day Paul took the men with him . They all made themselves pure and clean in the usual way . Then Paul went to the temple . There he reported the date when the days of cleansing would end . At that time the proper offering would be made for each of them .
44021027	The seven days of cleansing were almost over . Some Jews from Asia Minor saw Paul at the temple . They stirred up the whole crowd . They arrested Paul .
44021028	" Men of Israel , help us ! " they shouted . " This is the man who teaches everyone in all places against our people . He speaks against our law and against this holy place . Besides , he has brought Greeks into the temple area . He has made this holy place unclean . "
44021029	They said this because they had seen Trophimus the Ephesian in the city with Paul . They thought Paul had brought him into the temple area .
44021030	The whole city was stirred up . People came running from all directions . They grabbed Paul and dragged him out of the temple . Right away the temple gates were shut .
44021031	The people were trying to kill Paul . But news reached the commander of the Roman troops . He heard that people were making trouble in the whole city of Jerusalem .
44021032	At once he took some officers and soldiers with him . They ran down to the crowd . The people causing the trouble saw the commander and his soldiers . So they stopped beating Paul .
44021033	The commander came up and arrested Paul . He ordered him to be held with two chains . Then he asked who Paul was and what he had done .
44021034	Some in the crowd shouted one thing , some another . But the commander couldn't get the facts because of all the noise . So he ordered that Paul be taken into the fort .
44021035	Paul reached the steps . But then the mob became so wild that he had to be carried by the soldiers .
44021036	The crowd that followed kept shouting , " Kill him ! "
44021037	The soldiers were about to take Paul into the fort . Then he asked the commander , " May I say something to you ? " " Do you speak Greek ? " he replied .
44021038	" Aren't you the Egyptian who turned some of our people against their leaders ? Didn't you lead 4,000 terrorists out into the desert some time ago ? "
44021039	Paul answered , " I am a Jew from Tarsus in Cilicia . I am a citizen of an important city . Please let me speak to the people . "
44021040	The commander told him he could . So Paul stood on the steps and motioned to the crowd . When all of them were quiet , he spoke to them in the Aramaic language .
44022001	" Brothers and fathers , " Paul began , " listen to me now . I want to speak up for myself . "
44022002	When they heard that he was speaking to them in Aramaic , they became very quiet . Then Paul said ,
44022003	" I am a Jew . I was born in Tarsus in Cilicia . But I grew up here in Jerusalem . I was well trained by Gamaliel in the law of our people . I wanted to serve God as much as any of you do today .
44022004	I hurt the followers of the Way of Jesus . I sent many of them to their death . I arrested men and women . I threw them into prison .
44022005	The high priest and the whole Council can give witness to this . I even had some official letters they had written to their friends in Damascus . So I went there to bring these people as prisoners to Jerusalem to be punished .
44022006	" I had almost reached Damascus . About noon a bright light from heaven suddenly flashed around me .
44022007	I fell to the ground and heard a voice speak to me . ' Saul ! Saul ! ' it said . ' Why are you opposing me ? '
44022008	" ' Who are you , Lord ? ' I asked . " ' I am Jesus of Nazareth , ' he replied . ' I am the one you are opposing . '
44022009	" The light was seen by my companions . But they didn't understand the voice of the one speaking to me .
44022010	" ' What should I do , Lord ? ' I asked . " ' Get up , ' the Lord said . ' Go into Damascus . There you will be told everything you have been given to do . '
44022011	The brightness of the light had blinded me . So my companions led me by the hand into Damascus .
44022012	" A man named Ananias came to see me . He was a godly Jew who obeyed the law . All the Jews living there respected him very much .
44022013	He stood beside me and said , ' Brother Saul , receive your sight ! ' At that very moment I was able to see him .
44022014	" Then he said , ' The God of our people has chosen you . He wanted to tell you his plans for you . You have seen the Blameless One . You have heard words from his mouth .
44022015	Now you will give witness to all people about what you have seen and heard .
44022016	So what are you waiting for ? Get up and call on his name . Be baptized . Have your sins washed away . '
44022017	" I returned to Jerusalem and was praying at the temple . Then it seemed to me that I was dreaming .
44022018	I saw the Lord speaking to me . ' Quick ! ' he said . ' Leave Jerusalem at once . These people will not accept your witness about me . '
44022019	" ' Lord , ' I replied , ' these people know what I used to do . I went from one synagogue to another and put believers in prison . I also beat them .
44022020	Stephen was a man who gave witness to others about you . I stood there when he was killed . I had agreed that he should die . I even guarded the coats of those who were killing him . '
44022021	" Then the Lord said to me , ' Go . I will send you far away to people who are not Jews . ' "
44022022	The crowd listened to Paul until he said this . Then they shouted , " Kill him ! He isn't fit to live ! "
44022023	They shouted and threw off their coats . They threw dust into the air .
44022024	So the commanding officer ordered Paul to be taken into the fort . He gave orders for Paul to be whipped and questioned . He wanted to find out why the people were shouting at him like this .
44022025	A commander was standing there as they stretched Paul out to be whipped . Paul said to him , " Does the law allow you to whip a Roman citizen who hasn't even been found guilty ? "
44022026	When the commander heard this , he went to the commanding officer and reported it . " What are you going to do ? " the commander asked . " This man is a Roman citizen . "
44022027	So the commanding officer went to Paul . " Tell me , " he asked . " Are you a Roman citizen ? " " Yes , I am , " Paul answered .
44022028	Then the officer said , " I had to pay a lot of money to become a citizen . " " But I was born a citizen , " Paul replied .
44022029	Right away those who were about to question him left . Even the officer was alarmed . He realized that he had put Paul , a Roman citizen , in chains .
44022030	The commanding officer wanted to find out exactly what the Jews had against Paul . So the next day he let Paul out of prison . He ordered a meeting of the chief priests and all the Sanhedrin . Then he brought Paul and had him stand in front of them .
44023001	Paul looked straight at the Sanhedrin . " My brothers , " he said , " I have always done my duty to God . To this very day I feel that I have done nothing wrong . "
44023002	Ananias the high priest heard this . So he ordered the men standing near Paul to hit him on the mouth .
44023003	Then Paul said to him , " You pretender ! God will hit you ! You sit there and judge me by the law . But you yourself broke the law when you commanded them to hit me ! "
44023004	Those who were standing near Paul said , " How dare you talk like that to God's high priest ! "
44023005	Paul replied , " Brothers , I didn't realize he was the high priest . It is written , ' Do not speak evil about the ruler of your people . ' "
44023006	Paul knew that some of them were Sadducees and the others Pharisees . So he called out in the Sanhedrin . " My brothers , " he said , " I am a Pharisee . I am the son of a Pharisee . I believe that people will rise from the dead . That's why I am on trial . "
44023007	When he said this , the Pharisees and the Sadducees started to argue . They began to take sides .
44023008	The Sadducees say that people will not rise from the dead . They don't believe there are angels or spirits either . But the Pharisees believe all these things .
44023009	People were causing trouble and making a lot of noise . Some of the teachers of the law who were Pharisees stood up . They argued strongly . " We find nothing wrong with this man , " they said . " What if a spirit or an angel has spoken to him ? "
44023010	The arguing got out of hand . The commanding officer was afraid that Paul would be torn to pieces by those who were arguing . So he ordered the soldiers to go down and take him away from them by force . They were supposed to bring him into the fort .
44023011	The next night the Lord stood near Paul . He said , " Be brave ! You have given witness about me in Jerusalem . You must do the same in Rome . "
44023012	The next morning the Jews gathered secretly to make plans against Paul . They took an oath that they would not eat or drink anything until they had killed him .
44023013	More than 40 men took part in this plan .
44023014	They went to the chief priests and the elders . They said , " We have taken a strong oath . We have made a special promise to God . We will not eat anything until we have killed Paul .
44023015	Now then , you and the Sanhedrin must make an appeal to the commanding officer . Ask him to bring Paul to you . Pretend you want more facts about his case . We are ready to kill him before he gets here . "
44023016	But Paul's nephew heard about this plan . So he went into the fort and told Paul .
44023017	Then Paul called one of the commanders . He said to him , " Take this young man to the commanding officer . He has something to tell him . "
44023018	So the commander took Paul's nephew to the officer . The commander said , " Paul , the prisoner , sent for me . He asked me to bring this young man to you . The young man has something to tell you . "
44023019	The commanding officer took the young man by the hand . He spoke to him in private . " What do you want to tell me ? " the officer asked .
44023020	He said , " The Jews have agreed to ask you to bring Paul to the Sanhedrin tomorrow . They will pretend they want more facts about him .
44023021	Don't give in to them . More than 40 of them are waiting in hiding to attack him . They have taken an oath that they will not eat or drink anything until they have killed him . They are ready now . All they need is for you to bring Paul to the Sanhedrin . "
44023022	The commanding officer let the young man go . But he gave him a warning . " Don't tell anyone you have reported this to me , " he said .
44023023	Then the commanding officer called for two of his commanders . He ordered them , " Gather a company of 200 soldiers , 70 horsemen and 200 men armed with spears . Get them ready to go to Caesarea at nine o'clock tonight .
44023024	Provide horses for Paul so that he may be taken safely to Governor Felix . "
44023025	Here is the letter the officer wrote .
44023026	I , Claudius Lysias , am writing this letter . I am sending it to His Excellency , Governor Felix . Greetings .
44023027	The Jews grabbed Paul . They were about to kill him . But I came with my soldiers and saved him . I had learned that he is a Roman citizen .
44023028	I wanted to know why they were bringing charges against him . So I brought him to their Sanhedrin .
44023029	I found out that the charge against him was based on questions about their law . But there was no charge against him worthy of death or prison .
44023030	Then I was told about a plan against the man . So I sent him to you at once . I also ordered those bringing charges against him to tell you their case .
44023031	The soldiers followed their orders . During the night they took Paul with them . They brought him as far as Antipatris .
44023032	The next day they let the horsemen go on with him . The soldiers returned to the fort .
44023033	The horsemen arrived in Caesarea . They gave the letter to the governor . Then they handed Paul over to him .
44023034	The governor read the letter . He asked Paul where he was from . He learned that Paul was from Cilicia .
44023035	So he said , " I will hear your case when those bringing charges against you get here . " Then he ordered that Paul be kept under guard in Herod's palace .
44024001	Five days later Ananias the high priest went down to Caesarea . Some elders and a lawyer named Tertullus went with him . They brought their charges against Paul to the governor .
44024002	So Paul was called in . Tertullus began to bring the charges against Paul . He said to Felix , " We have enjoyed a long time of peace while you have been ruling . You are a wise leader . You have made this a better nation .
44024003	Most excellent Felix , we gladly admit this everywhere and in every way . And we are very thankful .
44024004	I don't want to bother you . But would you be kind enough to listen to us for a short time ?
44024005	" We have found that Paul is a troublemaker . He stirs up trouble among Jews all over the world . He is a leader of those who follow Jesus of Nazareth .
44024008	Question him yourself . Then you will learn the truth about all these charges we are bringing against him . "
44024009	The Jews said the same thing . They agreed that the charges were true .
44024010	The governor motioned for Paul to speak . Paul said , " I know that you have been a judge over this nation for quite a few years . So I am glad to stand up for myself .
44024011	About 12 days ago I went up to Jerusalem to worship . You can easily check on this .
44024012	Those bringing charges against me did not find me arguing with anyone at the temple . I wasn't stirring up a crowd in the synagogues or anywhere else in the city .
44024013	They can't prove to you any of the charges they are making against me .
44024014	" It is true that I worship the God of our people . I am a follower of the Way of Jesus . Those bringing charges against me call it a cult . I believe everything that agrees with the Law . I believe everything written in the Prophets .
44024015	I have the same hope in God that these men have . I believe that both the godly and the ungodly will rise from the dead .
44024016	So I always try not to do anything wrong in the eyes of God and man .
44024017	" I was away for several years . Then I came to Jerusalem to bring my people gifts for those who were poor . I also came to offer sacrifices .
44024018	They found me doing this in the temple courtyard . I had already been made pure and clean in the usual way . There was no crowd with me . I didn't stir up any trouble .
44024019	" But there are some other Jews who should be here in front of you . They are from Asia Minor . They should bring charges if they have anything against me .
44024020	Let the Jews who are here tell you what crime I am guilty of . After all , I was put on trial by the Sanhedrin .
44024021	Perhaps they blame me for what I said when I was on trial . I shouted , ' I believe that people will rise from the dead . That is why I am on trial here today . ' "
44024022	Felix knew all about the Way of Jesus . So he put off the trial for the time being . " Lysias the commanding officer will come , " he said . " Then I will decide your case . "
44024023	He ordered the commander to keep Paul under guard . He told him to give Paul some freedom . He also told him to allow Paul's friends to take care of his needs .
44024024	Several days later Felix came with his wife Drusilla . She was a Jew . Felix sent for Paul and listened to him speak about faith in Christ Jesus .
44024025	Paul talked about how to live right . He talked about how people should control themselves . He also talked about the time when God will judge everyone . Then Felix became afraid . " That's enough for now ! " he said . " You may leave . When I find the time , I will send for you . "
44024026	He was hoping that Paul would offer him some money to let him go . So he often sent for Paul and talked with him .
44024027	Two years passed . Porcius Festus took the place of Felix . But Felix wanted to do the Jews a favor . So he left Paul in prison .
44025001	Three days after Festus arrived , he went up from Caesarea to Jerusalem .
44025002	There the chief priests and Jewish leaders came to him and brought their charges against Paul .
44025003	They tried to get Festus to have Paul taken to Jerusalem . They asked for this as a favor . They were planning to hide and attack Paul along the way . They wanted to kill him .
44025004	Festus answered , " Paul is being held at Caesarea . Soon I'll be going there myself .
44025005	Let some of your leaders come with me . If the man has done anything wrong , they can bring charges against him there . "
44025006	Festus spent eight or ten days in Jerusalem with them . Then he went down to Caesarea . The next day he called the court together . He ordered Paul to be brought to him .
44025007	When Paul arrived , the Jews who had come down from Jerusalem stood around him . They brought many strong charges against him . But they couldn't prove them .
44025008	Then Paul spoke up for himself . He said , " I've done nothing wrong against the law of the Jews or against the temple . I've done nothing wrong against Caesar . "
44025009	But Festus wanted to do the Jews a favor . So he said to Paul , " Are you willing to go up to Jerusalem ? Are you willing to go on trial there ? Are you willing to face these charges in my court ? "
44025010	Paul answered , " I'm already standing in Caesar's court . This is where I should go on trial . I haven't done anything wrong to the Jews . You yourself know that very well .
44025011	If I am guilty of anything worthy of death , I'm willing to die . But the charges brought against me by these Jews are not true . No one has the right to hand me over to them . I make my appeal to Caesar ! "
44025012	Festus talked it over with the members of his court . Then he said , " You have made an appeal to Caesar . To Caesar you will go ! "
44025013	A few days later King Agrippa and Bernice arrived in Caesarea . They came to pay a visit to Festus .
44025014	They were spending many days there . So Festus talked with the king about Paul's case . He said , " There's a man here that Felix left as a prisoner .
44025015	When I went to Jerusalem , the Jewish chief priests and the elders brought charges against the man . They wanted him to be found guilty .
44025016	" I told them that this is not the way Romans do things . We don't judge people before they have faced those bringing charges against them . They must have a chance to speak up for themselves .
44025017	When the Jews came back with me , I didn't waste any time . I called the court together the next day . I ordered the man to be brought in .
44025018	Those bringing charges against him got up to speak . But they didn't charge him with any of the crimes I had expected .
44025019	Instead , they argued with him about their own beliefs . They didn't agree about a dead man named Jesus . Paul claimed Jesus was alive .
44025020	" I had no idea how to look into such matters . So I asked Paul if he would be willing to go to Jerusalem . There he could be tried on these charges .
44025021	But Paul made an appeal to have the Emperor decide his case . So I ordered him to be held until I could send him to Caesar . "
44025022	Then Agrippa said to Festus , " I would like to hear this man myself . " Festus replied , " Tomorrow you will hear him . "
44025023	The next day Agrippa and Bernice arrived . They acted like very important people . They entered the courtroom . The most important officers and the leading men of the city came with them . When Festus gave the command , Paul was brought in .
44025024	Festus said , " King Agrippa , and all who are here with us , take a good look at this man ! Both in Jerusalem and here in Caesarea a large number of Jews have come to me about him . They keep shouting that he shouldn't live any longer .
44025025	I have found that he hasn't done anything worthy of death . But he made his appeal to the Emperor . So I decided to send him to Rome .
44025026	" I don't have anything certain to write about him to His Majesty . So I have brought him here today . Now all of you will be able to hear him . King Agrippa , it will also be very good for you to hear him . As a result of this hearing , I will have something to write .
44025027	It doesn't make sense to send a prisoner to Rome without listing the charges against him . "
44026001	Agrippa said to Paul , " You may now speak for yourself . " So Paul motioned with his hand . Then he began to stand up for himself .
44026002	" King Agrippa , " he said , " I am happy to be able to stand here today . I will speak up for myself against all the charges brought by the Jews .
44026003	I am very pleased that you are familiar with Jewish ways . You know the kinds of things they argue about . So I beg you to be patient as you listen to me .
44026004	" The Jews all know how I have lived ever since I was a child . They know all about me from the beginning of my life . They know how I lived in my own country and in Jerusalem .
44026005	They have known me for a long time . So if they wanted to , they could give witness that I lived by the rules of the Pharisees . Those rules are harder to obey than the rules of any other group in the Jewish faith .
44026006	" Today I am on trial because of the hope I have . I believe in what God promised our people long ago .
44026007	It is the promise that our 12 tribes are hoping to see come true . Because of this hope they serve God with a true and honest heart day and night . King Agrippa , it is also because of this hope that the Jews are bringing charges against me .
44026008	Why should any of you think it is impossible for God to raise the dead ?
44026009	" I myself believed that I should do everything I could to oppose the name of Jesus of Nazareth .
44026010	That's just what I was doing in Jerusalem . On the authority of the chief priests , I put many of God's people in prison . I agreed that they should die .
44026011	I often went from one synagogue to another to have them punished . I tried to force them to speak evil things against Jesus . I hated them so much that I even went to cities in other lands to hurt them .
44026012	" On one of these journeys I was on my way to Damascus . I had the authority and commission of the chief priests .
44026013	About noon , King Agrippa , I was on the road . I saw a light coming from heaven . It was brighter than the sun . It was shining around me and my companions .
44026014	We all fell to the ground . I heard a voice speak to me in the Aramaic language . ' Saul ! Saul ! ' it said . ' Why are you opposing me ? It is hard for you to go against what you know is right . '
44026015	" Then I asked , ' Who are you , Lord ? ' " ' I am Jesus , ' the Lord replied . ' I am the one you are opposing .
44026016	Now get up . Stand on your feet . I have appeared to you to appoint you to serve me and be my witness . You will tell others that you have seen me today . You will also tell them that I will show myself to you again .
44026017	" ' I will save you from your own people and from those who aren't Jews . I am sending you to them
44026018	to open their eyes . I want you to turn them from darkness to light . I want you to turn them from Satan's power to God . I want their sins to be forgiven . They will be forgiven when they believe in me . They will have their place among God's people . '
44026019	" So then , King Agrippa , I obeyed the vision that appeared from heaven .
44026020	First I preached to people in Damascus . Then I preached in Jerusalem and in all Judea . I preached also to people who are not Jews . I told them to turn away from their sins to God . The way they live must prove that they have turned away from their sins .
44026021	That's why the Jews grabbed me in the temple courtyard and tried to kill me .
44026022	" But God has helped me to this very day . So I stand here and give witness to both small and great . I have been saying nothing different from what the prophets and Moses said would happen .
44026023	They said the Christ would suffer . He would be the first to rise from the dead . He would announce the light of life to his own people and to those who aren't Jews . "
44026024	While Paul was still speaking up for himself , Festus interrupted . " You are out of your mind , Paul ! " he shouted . " Your great learning is driving you crazy ! "
44026025	" I am not crazy , most excellent Festus , " Paul replied . " What I am saying is true and reasonable .
44026026	The king is familiar with these things . So I can speak openly to him . I am certain he knows everything that has been going on . After all , it was not done in secret .
44026027	King Agrippa , do you believe the prophets ? I know you do . "
44026028	Then Agrippa spoke to Paul . " Are you trying to talk me into becoming a Christian ? " he said . " Do you think you can do that in such a short time ? "
44026029	Paul replied , " I don't care if it takes a short time or a long time . I pray to God for you and all who are listening to me today . I pray that you may become like me , except for these chains . "
44026030	The king stood up . The governor and Bernice and those sitting with them stood up too .
44026031	They left the room and began to talk with one another . " Why should this man die or be put in prison ? " they said . " He has done nothing worthy of that ! "
44026032	Agrippa said to Festus , " This man could have been set free . But he has made an appeal to Caesar . "
44027001	It was decided that we would sail for Italy . Paul and some other prisoners were handed over to a Roman commander named Julius . He belonged to the Imperial Guard .
44027002	We boarded a ship from Adramyttium . It was about to sail for ports along the coast of Asia Minor . We headed out to sea . Aristarchus was with us . He was a Macedonian from Thessalonica .
44027003	The next day we landed at Sidon . There Julius was kind to Paul . He let Paul visit his friends so they could give him what he needed .
44027004	From there we headed out to sea again . We passed the calmer side of Cyprus because the winds were against us .
44027005	We sailed across the open sea off the coast of Cilicia and Pamphylia . Then we landed at Myra in Lycia .
44027006	There the commander found a ship from Alexandria sailing for Italy . He put us on board .
44027007	We moved along slowly for many days . We had trouble getting to Cnidus . The wind did not let us stay on course . So we passed the calmer side of Crete , opposite Salmone .
44027008	It was not easy to sail along the coast . Then we came to a place called Fair Havens . It was near the town of Lasea .
44027009	A lot of time had passed . Sailing had already become dangerous . By now it was after the Day of Atonement , a day of fasting . So Paul gave them a warning .
44027010	" Men , " he said , " I can see that our trip is going to be dangerous . The ship and everything in it will be lost . Our own lives will be in danger also . "
44027011	But the commander didn't listen to what Paul said . Instead , he followed the advice of the pilot and the ship's owner .
44027012	The harbor wasn't a good place for ships to stay during winter . So most of the people decided we should sail on . They hoped we would reach Phoenix . They wanted to spend the winter there . Phoenix was a harbor in Crete . It faced both southwest and northwest .
44027013	A gentle south wind began to blow . They thought that this was what they had been waiting for . So they pulled up the anchor and sailed along the shore of Crete .
44027014	Before very long , a wind blew down from the island . It had the force of a hurricane . It was called a " northeaster . "
44027015	The ship was caught by the storm . We could not keep it sailing into the wind . So we gave up and were driven along .
44027016	We passed the calmer side of a small island called Cauda . We almost lost the lifeboat .
44027017	So the men lifted it on board . Then they tied ropes under the ship itself to hold it together . They were afraid it would get stuck on the sandbars of Syrtis . They lowered the sea anchor and let the ship be driven along .
44027018	We took a very bad beating from the storm . The next day the crew began to throw the ship's contents overboard .
44027019	On the third day , they even threw the ship's gear overboard with their own hands .
44027020	The sun and stars didn't appear for many days . The storm was terrible . So we gave up all hope of being saved .
44027021	The men had not eaten for a long time . Paul stood up in front of them . " Men , " he said , " you should have taken my advice not to sail from Crete . Then you would have avoided this harm and loss .
44027022	" Now I beg you to be brave . Not one of you will die . Only the ship will be destroyed .
44027023	I belong to God and serve him . Last night his angel stood beside me .
44027024	The angel said , ' Do not be afraid , Paul . You must go on trial in front of Caesar . God has shown his grace by sparing the lives of all those sailing with you . '
44027025	" Men , continue to be brave . I have faith in God . It will happen just as he told me .
44027026	But we must run the ship onto the beach of some island . "
44027027	On the 14th night we were still being driven across the Sea of Adria . About midnight the sailors had a feeling that they were approaching land .
44027028	They measured how deep the water was . They found that it was 120 feet deep . A short time later they measured the water again . This time it was 90 feet deep .
44027029	They were afraid we would crash against the rocks . So they dropped four anchors from the back of the ship . They prayed that daylight would come .
44027030	The sailors wanted to escape from the ship . So they let the lifeboat down into the sea . They pretended they were going to lower some anchors from the front of the ship .
44027031	But Paul spoke to the commander and the soldiers . " These men must stay with the ship , " he said . " If they don't , you can't be saved . "
44027032	So the soldiers cut the ropes that held the lifeboat . They let it drift away .
44027033	Just before dawn Paul tried to get them all to eat . " For the last 14 days , " he said , " you have wondered what would happen . You have gone without food . You haven't eaten anything .
44027034	Now I am asking you to eat some food . You need it to live . Not one of you will lose a single hair from your head . "
44027035	After Paul said this , he took some bread and gave thanks to God . He did this where they all could see him . Then he broke it and began to eat .
44027036	All of them were filled with hope . So they ate some food .
44027037	There were 276 of us on board .
44027038	They ate as much as they wanted . They needed to make the ship lighter . So they threw the rest of the grain into the sea .
44027039	When daylight came , they saw a bay with a sandy beach . They didn't recognize the place . But they decided to run the ship onto the beach if they could .
44027040	So they cut the anchors loose and left them in the sea . At the same time , they untied the ropes that held the rudders . They lifted the sail at the front of the ship to the wind . Then they headed for the beach .
44027041	But the ship hit a sandbar . So the front of it got stuck and wouldn't move . The back of the ship was broken to pieces by the pounding of the waves .
44027042	The soldiers planned to kill the prisoners . They wanted to keep them from swimming away and escaping .
44027043	But the commander wanted to save Paul's life . So he kept the soldiers from carrying out their plan . He ordered those who could swim to jump overboard first and swim to land .
44027044	The rest were supposed to get there on boards or other pieces of the ship . That is how everyone reached land safely .
44028001	When we were safe on shore , we found out that the island was called Malta .
44028002	The people of the island were unusually kind . It was raining and cold . So they built a fire and welcomed all of us .
44028003	Paul gathered some sticks and put them on the fire . A poisonous snake was driven out by the heat . It fastened itself on Paul's hand .
44028004	The people of the island saw the snake hanging from his hand . They said to each other , " This man must be a murderer . He escaped from the sea . But Justice won't let him live . " Justice was the name of a goddess .
44028005	Paul shook the snake off into the fire . He was not harmed .
44028006	The people expected him to swell up . They thought he would suddenly fall dead . They waited for a long time . But they didn't see anything unusual happen to him . So they changed their minds . They said he was a god .
44028007	Publius owned property nearby . He was the chief official on the island . He welcomed us to his home . For three days he took care of us . He treated us with kindness .
44028008	His father was sick in bed . The man suffered from fever and dysentery . So Paul went in to see him . Paul prayed for him . He placed his hands on him and healed him .
44028009	Then the rest of the sick people on the island came . They too were healed .
44028010	The people of the island honored us in many ways . When we were ready to sail , they gave us the supplies we needed .
44028011	After three months we headed out to sea . We sailed in a ship that had stayed at the island during the winter . It was a ship from Alexandria . On the front of it the figures of twin gods were carved . Their names were Castor and Pollux .
44028012	We landed at Syracuse and stayed there for three days .
44028013	From there we sailed to Rhegium . The next day the south wind came up . The day after that , we reached Puteoli .
44028014	There we found some believers . They invited us to spend a week with them . At last we came to Rome .
44028015	The brothers and sisters there had heard we were coming . They traveled as far as the Forum of Appius and the Three Taverns to meet us . When Paul saw these people , he thanked God and was cheered up .
44028016	When we got to Rome , Paul was allowed to live by himself . But a soldier guarded him .
44028017	Three days later Paul called a meeting of the Jewish leaders . So they came . Paul said to them , " My brothers , I have done nothing against our people . I have also done nothing against what our people of long ago practiced . But I was arrested in Jerusalem . I was handed over to the Romans .
44028018	" They questioned me . And they wanted to let me go . They saw I wasn't guilty of any crime worthy of death .
44028019	But the Jews objected . So I had to make an appeal to Caesar . " It wasn't that I had anything against my own people .
44028020	I share Israel's hope . That is why I am held with this chain . So I have asked to see you and talk with you . "
44028021	They replied , " We have not received any letters from Judea about you . None of our companions who came from there has reported or said anything bad about you .
44028022	But we want to hear what your ideas are . We know that people everywhere are talking against those who believe as you do . "
44028023	They decided to meet Paul on a certain day . At that time even more people came to the place where he was staying . From morning until evening , he told them about God's kingdom and explained it to them . Using the Law of Moses and the Prophets , he tried to get them to believe in Jesus .
44028024	Some believed what he said . Others did not .
44028025	They didn't agree with each other . They began to leave after Paul had made a final statement . He said , " The Holy Spirit was right when he spoke to your people long ago . Through Isaiah the prophet the Spirit said ,
44028026	" ' Go to your people . Say to them , " You will hear but never understand . You will see but never know what you are seeing . "
44028027	These people's hearts have become stubborn . They can barely hear with their ears . They have closed their eyes . Otherwise they might see with their eyes . They might hear with their ears . They might understand with their hearts . They might turn , and then I would heal them . '
44028030	For two whole years Paul stayed there in a house he rented . He welcomed all who came to see him .
44028031	He preached boldly about God's kingdom . No one could keep him from teaching people about the Lord Jesus Christ .
45001001	I , Paul , am writing this letter . I serve Christ Jesus . I have been appointed to be an apostle . God set me apart to tell others his good news .
45001002	He promised the good news long ago . He announced it through his prophets in the Holy Scriptures .
45001003	The good news is about God's Son . As a human being , the Son of God belonged to King David's family line .
45001004	By the power of the Holy Spirit , he was appointed to be the mighty Son of God because he rose from the dead . He is Jesus Christ our Lord .
45001005	I received God's grace because of what Jesus did so that I could bring glory to him . He made me an apostle to all those who aren't Jews . I must invite them to have faith in God and obey him .
45001006	You also are among those who are appointed to belong to Jesus Christ .
45001007	I am sending this letter to all of you in Rome who are loved by God and appointed to be his people . May God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ give you grace and peace .
45001008	First , I thank my God through Jesus Christ for all of you . People all over the world are talking about your faith .
45001009	I serve God with my whole heart . I preach the good news about his Son . God knows that I always remember you
45001010	in my prayers . I pray that now at last it may be God's plan to open the way for me to visit you .
45001011	I long to see you . I want to make you strong by giving you a gift from the Holy Spirit .
45001012	I want us to cheer each other up by sharing our faith .
45001013	Brothers and sisters , I want you to know that I planned many times to visit you . But until now I have been kept from coming . My work has produced results among others who are not Jews . In the same way , I want to see results among you .
45001014	I have a duty both to Greeks and to non-Greeks . I have a duty both to wise people and to foolish people .
45001015	So I really want to preach the good news also to you who live in Rome .
45001016	I am not ashamed of the good news . It is God's power . And it will save everyone who believes . It is meant first for the Jews . It is meant also for those who aren't Jews .
45001017	The good news shows how God makes people right with himself . From beginning to end , becoming right with God depends on a person's faith . It is written , " Those who are right with God will live by faith . "
45001018	God shows his anger from heaven . It is against all the godless and evil things people do . They are so evil that they say no to the truth .
45001019	The truth about God is plain to them . God has made it plain .
45001020	Ever since the world was created it has been possible to see the qualities of God that are not seen . I'm talking about his eternal power and about the fact that he is God . Those things can be seen in what he has made . So people have no excuse for what they do .
45001021	They knew God . But they didn't honor him as God . They didn't thank him . Their thinking became worthless . Their foolish hearts became dark .
45001022	They claimed to be wise . But they made fools of themselves .
45001023	They would rather have statues of gods than the glorious God who lives forever . Their statues of gods are made to look like people , birds , animals and reptiles .
45001024	So God let them go . He allowed them to do what their sinful hearts wanted to . He let them commit sexual sins . They polluted one another's bodies by what they did .
45001025	They chose a lie instead of God's truth . They worshiped and served created things . They didn't worship the Creator . But he must be praised forever . Amen .
45001026	So God let them go . They were filled with shameful longings . Their women committed sexual acts that were not natural .
45001027	In the same way , the men turned away from their natural love for women . They burned with sexual longing for each other . Men did shameful things with other men . They suffered in their bodies for all the twisted things they did .
45001028	They didn't think it was important to know God . So God let them go . He allowed them to have dirty minds . They did things they shouldn't do .
45001029	They are full of every kind of sin , evil and ungodliness . They want more than they need . They commit murder . They want what belongs to other people . They fight and cheat . They hate others . They say mean things about other people .
45001030	They tell lies about them . They hate God . They are rude and proud . They brag . They think of new ways to do evil . They don't obey their parents .
45001031	They are foolish . They can't be trusted . They are not loving and kind .
45001032	They know that God's commands are right . They know that those who do evil things should die . But they continue to do those very things . They also approve of others who do them .
45002001	If you judge someone else , you have no excuse for it . When you judge another person , you are judging yourself . You do the same things you blame others for doing .
45002002	We know that when God judges those who do evil things , he judges fairly .
45002003	Though you are only a human being , you judge others . But you yourself do the same things . So how do you think you will escape when God judges you ?
45002004	Do you make fun of God's great kindness and favor ? Do you make fun of God when he is patient with you ? Don't you realize that God's kindness is meant to turn you away from your sins ?
45002005	But you are stubborn . In your heart you are not sorry for your sins . You are storing up anger against yourself . The day of God's anger is coming . Then his way of judging fairly will be shown .
45002006	God " will give to each person in keeping with what he has done . "
45002007	God will give eternal life to those who keep on doing good . They want glory , honor , and life that never ends .
45002008	But there are others who only look out for themselves . They don't accept the truth . They go down an evil path . God will pour out his burning anger on them .
45002009	There will be trouble and suffering for everyone who does evil . That is meant first for the Jews . It is also meant for the non-Jews .
45002010	But there will be glory , honor and peace for everyone who does good . That is meant first for the Jews . It is also meant for the non-Jews .
45002011	God treats everyone the same .
45002012	Some people do not know God's law when they sin . They will not be judged by the law when they die . Others do know God's law when they sin . They will be judged by the law .
45002013	Hearing the law does not make a person right with God . People are considered to be right with God only when they obey the law .
45002014	Those who aren't Jews do not have the law . Sometimes they just naturally do what the law requires . They are a law for themselves . This is true even though they don't have the law .
45002015	They show that what the law requires is written on their hearts . The way their minds judge them gives witness to that fact . Sometimes their thoughts find them guilty . At other times their thoughts find them not guilty .
45002016	People will be judged on the day God appoints Jesus Christ to judge their secret thoughts . That's part of my good news .
45002017	Suppose you call yourself a Jew . You trust in the law . You brag that you are close to God .
45002018	You know what God wants . You agree with what is best because the law teaches you .
45002019	You are sure you can lead people who are blind . You are sure you are a light for those who are in the dark .
45002020	You claim to be able to teach foolish people . You can even teach babies . You think that in the law you have all knowledge and truth .
45002021	You teach others . But you don't teach yourself ! You preach against stealing . But you steal !
45002022	You say that people should not commit adultery . But you commit adultery ! You hate statues of gods . But you rob temples !
45002023	You brag about the law . But when you break it , you rob God of his honor !
45002024	It is written , " Those who aren't Jews say evil things against God's name because of you . "
45002025	Circumcision has value if you obey the law . But if you break the law , it is just as if you hadn't been circumcised .
45002026	Sometimes those who aren't circumcised do what the law requires . Won't God accept them as if they had been circumcised ?
45002027	Many are not circumcised physically , but they obey the law . They will prove that you are guilty . You are breaking the law , even though you have the written law and are circumcised .
45002028	A man is not a Jew if he is a Jew only on the outside . And circumcision is more than just something done to the outside of a man's body .
45002029	No , a man is a Jew only if he is a Jew on the inside . And true circumcision means that the heart has been circumcised . It is done by the Holy Spirit . It is more than just obeying the written Law . Then a man's praise will not come from others . It will come from God .
45003001	Is there any advantage in being a Jew ? Is there any value in being circumcised ?
45003002	There is great value in every way ! First of all , the Jews have been given the very words of God .
45003003	What if some Jews did not believe ? Will the fact that they don't have faith keep God from being faithful ?
45003004	Not at all ! God is true , even though every human being is a liar . It is written , " You are right when you sentence me . You are fair when you judge me . "
45003005	Doesn't the fact that we are wrong prove more clearly that God is right ? Then what can we say ? Can we say that God is not fair when he brings his anger down on us ? As you can tell , I am just using human ways of thinking .
45003006	God is certainly fair ! If he weren't , how could he judge the world ?
45003007	Someone might argue , " When I lie , it becomes clearer that God is truthful . It makes his glory shine more brightly . Why then does he find me guilty of sin ? "
45003008	Why not say , " Let's do evil things so that good things will happen " ? Some people actually lie by reporting that this is what we say . They are the ones who should be found guilty .
45003009	What should we say then ? Are we Jews any better ? Not at all ! We have already claimed that Jews are sinners . The same is true of those who aren't Jews .
45003010	It is written , " No one is right with God , no one at all .
45003011	No one understands . No one trusts in God .
45003012	All of them have turned away . They have all become worthless . No one does anything good , no one at all . "
45003013	" Their throats are like open graves . With their tongues they tell lies . " " The words from their lips are like the poison of a snake . "
45003014	" Their mouths are full of curses and bitterness . "
45003015	" They run quickly to commit murder .
45003016	They leave a trail of failure and pain .
45003017	They do not know the way of peace . "
45003018	" They don't have any respect for God . "
45003019	What the law says , it says to those who are ruled by the law . Its purpose is to shut every mouth and make the whole world accountable to God .
45003020	So it can't be said that anyone will be made right with God by obeying the law . Not at all ! The law makes us more aware of our sin .
45003021	But now God has shown us how to become right with him . The Law and the Prophets give witness to this . It has nothing to do with obeying the law .
45003022	We are made right with God by putting our faith in Jesus Christ . That happens to all who believe . It is no different for the Jews than for anyone else .
45003023	Everyone has sinned . No one measures up to God's glory .
45003024	The free gift of God's grace makes all of us right with him . Christ Jesus paid the price to set us free .
45003025	God gave him as a sacrifice to pay for sins . So he forgives the sins of those who have faith in his blood . God did all of that to prove that he is fair . Because of his mercy he did not punish people for the sins they had committed before Jesus died for them .
45003026	God did that to prove in our own time that he is fair . He proved that he is right . He also made right with himself those who believe in Jesus .
45003027	So who can brag ? No one ! Are people saved by obeying the law ? Not at all ! They are saved because of their faith .
45003028	We firmly believe that people are made right with God because of their faith . They are not saved by obeying the law .
45003029	Is God the God of Jews only ? Isn't he also the God of those who aren't Jews ? Yes , he is their God too .
45003030	There is only one God . When those who are circumcised believe in him , he makes them right with himself . When those who are not circumcised believe in him , he also makes them right with himself .
45003031	Does faith make the law useless ? Not at all ! We agree with the law .
45004001	What should we say about those things ? What did our father Abraham discover about being right with God ?
45004002	Did he become right with God because of something he did ? If so , he could brag about it . But he couldn't brag to God .
45004003	What do we find in Scripture ? It says , " Abraham believed God . God accepted Abraham's faith , and so his faith made him right with God . "
45004004	When a man works , his pay is not considered a gift . It is owed to him .
45004005	But things are different with God . He makes evil people right with himself . If people trust in him , their faith is accepted even though they do not work . Their faith makes them right with God .
45004006	King David says the same thing . He tells us how blessed some people are . God makes those people right with himself . But they don't have to do anything in return . David says ,
45004007	" Blessed are those whose lawless acts are forgiven . Blessed are those whose sins are taken away .
45004008	Blessed is the man whose sin the Lord never counts against him . "
45004009	Is that blessing only for those who are circumcised ? Or is it also for those who are not circumcised ? We have been saying that God accepted Abraham's faith , and so his faith made him right with God .
45004010	When did it happen ? Was it after Abraham was circumcised , or before ? It was before he was circumcised , not after !
45004011	He was circumcised as a sign of the covenant God had made with him . It showed that his faith had made him right with God before he was circumcised . So Abraham is the father of all believers who have not been circumcised . God accepts their faith . So their faith makes them right with him .
45004012	Abraham is also the father of the circumcised who believe . So just being circumcised is not enough . Those who are circumcised must also follow the steps of our father Abraham . He had faith before he was circumcised .
45004013	Abraham and his family received a promise . God promised that Abraham would receive the world . It would not come to him because he obeyed the law . It would come because of his faith , which made him right with God .
45004014	Do those who obey the law receive the promise ? If they do , faith would have no value . God's promise would be worthless .
45004015	The law brings God's anger . Where there is no law , the law can't be broken .
45004016	The promise is based on God's grace . The promise comes by faith . All of Abraham's children will certainly receive the promise . And it is not only for those who are ruled by the law . Those who have the same faith that Abraham had are also included . He is the father of us all .
45004017	It is written , " I have made you a father of many nations . " God considers Abraham to be our father . The God that Abraham believed in gives life to the dead . Abraham's God also speaks of things that do not exist as if they do exist .
45004018	When there was no reason for hope , Abraham believed because he had hope . He became the father of many nations , exactly as God had promised . God said , " That is how many children you will have . "
45004019	Without becoming weak in his faith , Abraham accepted the fact that he was past the time when he could have children . At that time he was about 100 years old . He also realized that Sarah was too old to have children .
45004020	But he kept believing in God's promise . He became strong in his faith . He gave glory to God .
45004021	He was absolutely sure that God had the power to do what he had promised .
45004022	That's why " God accepted Abraham because he believed . So his faith made him right with God . "
45004023	The words " God accepted Abraham's faith " were written not only for Abraham .
45004024	They were written also for us . We believe in the God who raised Jesus our Lord from the dead . So God will accept our faith and make us right with himself .
45004025	Jesus was handed over to die for our sins . He was raised to life in order to make us right with God .
45005001	We have been made right with God because of our faith . Now we have peace with him because of our Lord Jesus Christ .
45005002	Through faith in Jesus we have received God's grace . In that grace we stand . We are full of joy because we expect to share in God's glory .
45005003	And that's not all . We are full of joy even when we suffer . We know that our suffering gives us the strength to go on .
45005004	The strength to go on produces character . Character produces hope .
45005005	And hope will never let us down . God has poured his love into our hearts . He did it through the Holy Spirit , whom he has given to us .
45005006	At just the right time Christ died for ungodly people . He died for us when we had no power of our own .
45005007	It is unusual for anyone to die for a godly person . Maybe someone would be willing to die for a good person .
45005008	But here is how God has shown his love for us . While we were still sinners , Christ died for us .
45005009	The blood of Christ has made us right with God . So we are even more sure that Jesus will save us from God's anger .
45005010	Once we were God's enemies . But we have been brought back to him because his Son has died for us . Now that God has brought us back , we are even more secure . We know that we will be saved because Christ lives .
45005011	And that is not all . We are full of joy in God because of our Lord Jesus Christ . Because of him , God has brought us back to himself .
45005012	Sin entered the world because one man sinned . And death came because of sin . Everyone sinned , so death came to all people .
45005013	Before the law was given , sin was in the world . But sin is not judged when there is no law .
45005014	Death ruled from the time of Adam to the time of Moses . Death ruled even over those who did not sin as Adam did . He broke God's command . But he also became a pattern of the One who was going to come .
45005015	God's gift is different from Adam's sin . Many people died because of the sin of that one man . But it was even more sure that God's grace would also come through one man . That man is Jesus Christ . God's gift of grace was more than enough for the whole world .
45005016	The result of God's gift is different from the result of Adam's sin . God judged one sin . That brought guilt . But after many sins , God's gift made people right with him .
45005017	One man sinned , and death ruled because of his sin . But we are even more sure of what will happen because of what the one man , Jesus Christ , has done . Those who receive the rich supply of God's grace will rule with Christ in his kingdom . They have received God's gift and have been made right with him .
45005018	One man's sin brought guilt to all people . So also one right act made all people right with God . And all who are right with God will live .
45005019	Many people were made sinners because one man did not obey . But one man did obey . That is why many people will be made right with God .
45005020	The law was given so that sin would increase . But where sin increased , God's grace increased even more .
45005021	Sin ruled because of death . So also grace rules in the lives of those who are right with God . The grace of God brings eternal life because of what Jesus Christ our Lord has done .
45006001	What should we say then ? Should we keep on sinning so that God's grace can increase ?
45006002	Not at all ! As far as sin is concerned , we are dead . So how can we keep on sinning ?
45006003	All of us were baptized into Christ Jesus . Don't you know that we were baptized into his death ?
45006004	By being baptized , we were buried with Christ into his death . Christ has been raised from the dead by the Father's glory . And like Christ we also can live a new life .
45006005	By being baptized , we have been joined with him in his death . We will certainly also be joined with him in his resurrection .
45006006	We know that what we used to be was nailed to the cross with him . That happened so our sinful bodies would lose their power . We are no longer slaves of sin .
45006007	Those who have died have been set free from sin .
45006008	We died with Christ . So we believe that we will also live with him .
45006009	We know that Christ was raised from the dead and will never die again . Death doesn't control him anymore .
